meanings.definition: A hormone produced by the kidneys that stimulates red blood cell production in the bone marrow.
meanings.sent1: Erythropoietin helps make more red blood cells in the bone marrow.
meanings.sent2: The body releases erythropoietin to increase the number of red blood cells.
meanings.sent3: When the kidneys chat with the bone marrow, they talk about erythropoietin.
meanings.sent4: The kidneys act like conductors, directing the orchestra of red blood cells with erythropoietin as the baton.
meanings.sent5: Imagine erythropoietin as a superhero, swooping in to save the day by boosting red blood cell production.
